text: Daniel’s Prayer for His People

In \add the\add* first year \add of\add* Darius, \add the\add* son of Ahasuerus,\f + \fr 9:1 \ft That is, Xerxes \f* from \add the\add* offspring of \add the\add* Medes, who became king over \add the\add* kingdom of \add the\add* Chaldeans—

in \add the\add* first year \add of\add* his kingship I, Daniel, observed in the scrolls the number of the years that it was \add that were\add* to be fulfilled \add according to\add* \add the\add* word of Yahweh to Jeremiah the prophet for the devastation of Jerusalem—seventy years.
Then I turned my face to the Lord God to seek \add him\add* \add by\add* prayer and pleas for mercy,\f + \fr 9:3 \ft Or “supplications” \f* in fasting and \add in\add* sackcloth and ashes.

And I prayed to Yahweh my God, and I made confession and I said, “O Lord, the great and awesome God, keeping the covenant and loyal love with \add those who\add* love him and with \add those who\add* keep his commandments,
we have sinned and we have done wrong and we acted wickedly and we rebelled and \add have been\add* turning aside from your commandments and from your ordinances.
We have not listened to your servants the prophets, who spoke in your name to our kings, our princes and our ancestors\f + \fr 9:6 \ft Or “fathers” \f* and to all the people of the land.

“⸤Righteousness belongs to you, O Lord⸥,\f + \fr 9:7 \ft Literally “for you Lord the righteousness” \f* and on us \add is\add* open shame, \add just\add* as \add it is\add* this day to the people of Judah and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem and to all Israel, ⸤those who are near and those who are far off⸥\f + \fr 9:7 \ft Literally “those near and those far” \f* in all the lands \add to\add* which you have driven them,\f + \fr 9:7 \ft Hebrew “\fq to \ft which you have driven them there” \f* because of their infidelity which they displayed against you.
Yahweh, on us \add is\add* open shame, on our kings, on our princes, and on our ancestors,\f + \fr 9:8 \ft Or “fathers” \f* because we have sinned against you.
⸤Compassion and forgiveness belong to the Lord, our God⸥,\f + \fr 9:9 \ft Literally “to \fq the \ft Lord our God the compassion and the forgiveness” \f* for we have rebelled against him,

and we have not listened to the voice of Yahweh our God, by following his law ⸤which he placed before us⸥\f + \fr 9:10 \ft Literally “which he gave to the face of us” \f* by \add the\add* hand of his servants the prophets.

“And all Israel transgressed your law and turned aside \add so as\add* not to listen to your voice, and \add so\add* the curse and the oath which \add was\add* written in the law of Moses, the servant of God, has been poured out upon us, because we have sinned against him.

And \add so\add* he \add has\add* carried out his words which he spoke against us and against our rulers who ruled us, to bring upon us \add a\add* great calamity which was not done under all \add of\add* heaven as it was done in Jerusalem.

Just as \add it is\add* written in the law of Moses, all of this calamity has come upon us, and ⸤we have not implored⸥\f + \fr 9:13 \ft Literally “we not implored” \f* the face of Yahweh our God \add so as\add* to turn from our iniquities and to attend closely to your faithfulness.\f + \fr 9:13 \ft Or “truth” \f*

So Yahweh \add has\add* kept watch over the\f + \fr 9:14 \ft Or “his” \f* calamity, and \add now\add* he \add has\add* brought it upon us. Indeed, Yahweh our God \add is\add* righteous concerning all his works\f + \fr 9:14 \ft Or “acts” \f* that he has done, but we have not listened to his voice.

“And now, Lord our God, who have brought your people out from \add the\add* land of Egypt with a strong hand, and you \add have\add* made for yourself a name \add until\add* this day—we have sinned, we have acted wickedly.

Lord, according to all your righteousness, please let your anger and your rage turn away from your city Jerusalem, ⸤your holy mountain⸥,\f + \fr 9:16 \ft Literally “the mountain of your holiness” \f* because through our sins and through the iniquities of our ancestors\f + \fr 9:16 \ft Or “fathers” \f* Jerusalem and your people have become an object of mockery among all of our neighbors.

“And now, listen to the prayer of your servant and to his pleas for mercy. Shine\f + \fr 9:17 \ft Or “let shine” or “cause to shine” \f* your face upon your desolate sanctuary ⸤for your sake, O Lord⸥.\f + \fr 9:17 \ft Literally “for the sake of the Lord” \f*

Incline your ear, my God, and listen; open your eyes and look at our desolation and the city that is called \add by\add* your name, for we \add are\add* not presenting our pleas for mercy ⸤before you⸥\f + \fr 9:18 \ft Literally “to the face of you” \f* because of our righteousness, but \add rather\add* because of your great compassion.

Lord, listen! Lord, forgive! Lord, pay heed and act! You must not delay ⸤for your sake⸥,\f + \fr 9:19 \ft Literally “for the sake of you” \f* my God; because ⸤your city and your people are called by your name⸥.”\f + \fr 9:19 \ft Literally “your name is called over your city and over your people” \f*
Gabriel’s Announcement and Presentation of the Seventy Sets of Seven

Now I \add was\add* still speaking and praying, and confessing my sin and the sin of my people Israel, and presenting my plea ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 9:20 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* Yahweh my God, on behalf ⸤of the holy mountain of my God⸥.\f + \fr 9:20 \ft Literally “the mountain of the holiness of my God” \f*

And I \add was\add* still speaking in prayer, and the man Gabriel, whom I had seen in the vision ⸤previously⸥,\f + \fr 9:21 \ft Literally “in the beginning” \f* ⸤in my weariness touched me⸥\f + \fr 9:21 \ft Literally “\fq my \ft being wearied, touching me” \f* at \add the\add* time of \add the\add* evening offering.
And he instructed \add me\add* and he spoke with me and he said, “Daniel I have now come out\f + \fr 9:22 \ft Or “forth” \f* to teach you understanding.

At the beginning of your pleas for mercy, a word went out, and \add now\add* I have come to declare\f + \fr 9:23 \ft Or “deliver” \f* \add it\add*, for you \add are\add* highly esteemed, and \add so\add* consider the word and understand the vision.
The Seventy Sets of Seven Detailed

“Seventy weeks is decreed for your people and ⸤for your holy city⸥,\f + \fr 9:24 \ft Literally “for \fq the \ft city of your holiness” \f* to put an end to the transgression and to seal \add up\add* sin\f + \fr 9:24 \ft Or “to make an end to sin” \f* and to make atonement for guilt and to bring \add in\add* everlasting righteousness and to seal vision and prophet and to anoint ⸤the most holy place⸥.\f + \fr 9:24 \ft Literally “the holy place of holy places” \f*

And you must know and you must understand\f + \fr 9:25 \ft Or “so you are to know and discern” (NASB), or “know then and understand” (e.g. NEB) \f* \add that\add* from \add the\add* time of the going out of \add the\add* word to restore and build Jerusalem until \add an\add* anointed\f + \fr 9:25 \ft Or “messiah” \f* \add one\add*—\add a\add* leader—\add will be\add* ⸤seven weeks and sixty-two weeks⸥;\f + \fr 9:25 \ft Literally “weeks seven and weeks sixty and two” \f* it will be restored and will be built \add with\add* streets and \add a\add* moat, but ⸤in a time of oppression⸥.\f + \fr 9:25 \ft Literally “in distress/oppression of the times/time” \f*

“And after the sixty and two weeks an anointed one\f + \fr 9:26 \ft Or “messiah” \f* shall be cut off, and ⸤he shall have nothing⸥,\f + \fr 9:26 \ft Literally “there is not for him” \f* and \add the\add* people of the coming leader will destroy the city and the sanctuary,\f + \fr 9:26 \ft Or “holy place” \f* and its end \add will be\add* with the flood and \add on\add* to \add the\add* end \add there shall be\add* war; \add these\add* desolations are determined.

And he will make a strong covenant with the many \add for\add* one week, but \add in\add* half of the week he will let cease sacrifice and offering ⸤and in its place⸥\f + \fr 9:27 \ft Literally “and on a wing of” \f* a desolating abomination \add comes\add* even until ⸤the determined complete destruction⸥\f + \fr 9:27 \ft Literally “a complete destruction and being determined” \f* is poured out on \add the\add* desolator.”
